headline: Better Enterprise Software Stock: ServiceNow vs. Salesforce
summary: Can Salesforce's AI-driven future outpace ServiceNow's equally AI-powered hypergrowth? One of these software giants walks away with the "better buy now" trophy, and it's not a close race.

headline: Up Approximately 8,000% the Past 20 Years, This Stock Just Shot Higher on Increased Guidance. Can the Momentum Continue?
summary: In early December 2004, Salesforce (NYSE: CRM) was trading at a split-adjusted price of under $4.  Salesforce is the granddaddy of software-as-as-service (SaaS) companies, helping revolutionize the software industry.  Today, it is looking toward artificial intelligence (AI) as its next big growth driver.

headline: The Secret Weapon Helping Businesses Get Results from AI: Humans
summary: Businesses using the latest generation of artificial intelligence have a surprising requirement: actual human intelligence.  Companies that succeed with modern generative AI tools—such as  Microsoft  Copilot,  Salesforce  Agentforce, or offerings from a raft of new startups—are discovering that in order to get real value from AI, they have to organize their data in ways they might not have before.
